question:
District category contains Tech Park, and Ancient City.
Supermarkets category contains Earth Fare, and King Soopers.
Product category contains Yogurt, and Croissants.
The number of each King Soopers 's Yogurt equals 1 more than each Ancient City 's Supermarkets.
The number of each Earth Fare 's Yogurt equals 17.
The number of each Earth Fare 's Croissants equals 18 more than each Earth Fare 's Yogurt.
The number of each Tech Park 's King Soopers equals the difference of each Ancient City 's Supermarkets and each Ancient City 's Earth Fare.
The number of each Tech Park 's Earth Fare equals the sum of each Earth Fare 's Product and each Earth Fare 's Yogurt.
The number of each King Soopers 's Croissants equals 6.
The number of each Ancient City 's Earth Fare equals each Earth Fare 's Yogurt.
The number of each Ancient City 's King Soopers equals the difference of each Tech Park 's Earth Fare and each Earth Fare 's Product.
How many Yogurt does King Soopers have?
solution:
Define each Earth Fare 's Yogurt as O; So O = 17.
Define each Earth Fare 's Croissants as x; So x = 18 + O = 18 + 17 = 12.
Define each Earth Fare 's Product as e; So e = O + x = 17 + 12 = 6.
Define each Tech Park 's Earth Fare as N; So N = e + O = 6 + 17 = 0.
Define each Ancient City 's King Soopers as D; So D = N - e = 0 - 6 = 17.
Define each Ancient City 's Earth Fare as Z; So Z = O = 17.
Define each Ancient City 's Supermarkets as C; So C = D + Z = 17 + 17 = 11.
Define each King Soopers 's Yogurt as j; So j = 1 + C = 1 + 11 = 12.
